Abstract:
The MODIS/Terra V4 LST/E Monthly L3 Global CMG product (Short name: MOD11C3) is a monthly composited average, derived from the MOD11C1 daily global product, and stored as clear-sky LST values during a month’s period in a 0.05º (5600 meters) geographic CMG. MOD11C3, therefore, inherits all the structural features of its MOD11C1 parent except for the temporal configuration. Please refer to the MOD11C1 product documentation for all algorithm-related details.

The V4 MOD11C3 product comprises the following Science Data Set (SDS) layers for daytime and nighttime observations: LSTs, quality control assessments, observation times, view zenith angles, clear sky coverages, and emissivities for bands 20, 22, 23, 29, 31, and 32.

The V4 Terra/MODIS LST/E products, including MOD11C3, are validated to Stage-1 with well-defined uncertainties over a range of representative conditions. Further details regarding MODIS land product validation for the LST/E products is available from the following URL: http://landval.gsfc.nasa.gov/ProductStatus.php?ProductID=MOD11

This product is ready for use in science applications/publications. Subsequent and improved versions of this product also exist.

The V4 MOD11C3 product has an acquisition range from March 1, 2000 until December 31, 2006 (2006-365). The V4 collection remains consistent with V41, and users may combine the two collections in a time-series analysis.

V004 Data Set Characteristics: 
Area: Global 
Image Dimensions: 3600 x 7200 rows/columns 
File Size: 440 MB 
Resolution: 5 degrees (~5.6 km at the Equator) 
Projection: Sinusoidal 
Data Format: HDF-EOS 
Science Data Sets (SDS HDF Layers): 16

LP DAAC Data Pool provides direct access to all currently available MODIS products and the ability to download them via HTTP.

USGS EarthExplorer (EE) provides users the ability to query, search and order archived products available from the LP DAAC.  Registered users of EE have access to additional features than guest users.

The Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC) is one of several discipline-specific data centers within the NASA Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS).  The LP DAAC Web page provides information about available data products, services, documentation, order interfaces, and tools.
The MODIS Land home page is maintained through NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and documents various aspects of the land component of the MODIS mission.
